name: Tripadvisor
tagline: The world’s largest travel site. Know better. Book better. Go better.

target_groups.name: Tier 1 Targets
target_groups.description_html: Our main web application www.tripadvisor.com communicates with tier1 APIs for payment functionalities. There is no public documentation for the CDE API, but all endpoints can be discovered by interacting with payment functionalities on www.tripadvisor.com.

target_groups.name: Tier 2 Targets
target_groups.description_html:
You may use the following API key: adf6d1b8-0aca-4b0c-a492-50530aadd7aa

You can see overview of our APIs at https://developer-tripadvisor.com/home/
Partner API documentation can be found at http://api.tripadvisor.com/api/partner/2.0/doc?key=adf6d1b8-0aca-4b0c-a492-50530aadd7aa

Tripadvisor has now enabled the ability to assign property ownership for testing. Use the Request a Response (RAR) feature to become an owner of a test property.

Include in the request your @bugcrowdninja.com email address and the Property ID you want to own.

targets.name: Localized versions of www.tripadvisor.com available from the site's header or footer

target_groups.name: Tier 3 Targets
target_groups.description_html: Note that tamg.cloud subdomains that end with -sbx are sandbox (testing) projects. Normally, only test data flows through them therefore disclosing "sensitive" data on those is mostly not an issue in reality.

targets.name: Any publicly accessible Tripadvisor web asset or host (domains, ip space, etc) - except for assets listed as Out-of-Scope below.

target_groups.name: Tripadvisor Mobile
target_groups.description_html:
The apps can be downloaded via Google Play for Android or the App Store for iOS:

  • https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.tripadvisor.tripadvisor&hl=en&gl=US&pli=1
  • https://apps.apple.com/us/app/tripadvisor-plan-book-trips/id284876795

target_groups.name: Vacation Rentals
target_groups.description_html:
Note that submissions for vacation rentals section are rewarded with points only, they are not eligible for bounties.

You can register a new owner account by clicking the "Link your property" link on the domain you are visiting. To ensure a property is listed on a particular website use the registration link on that website. For example, a home registered at FlipKey will definitely be listed on FlipKey but may not be listed at Holiday Lettings.

A new account requires both the email address and the mobile number to be verified before properties can be published. The email address can be validated by clicking a link in the email sent. To verify the mobile number do either of the following:

  • Register using the test number above and email bugcrowd-tavr@tripadvisor.com with the details of your account to get the test number verified.
  • Register a real mobile number and enter the code sent via SMS when prompted.

Once you have completed all the tests you wanted to execute against a test property, please disable that test property in order for it not show up anymore on the websites! We reserve the right to disable test properties if they do not meet the guideline or have been live for a while.

IMPORTANT: If you want your properties to be distributed to vacationhomerentals.com, you will need to request that explicitly. To do so, email bugcrowd-tavr@tripadvisor.com with the subject "Request to switch owner to VHR" and provide your owner ID. Once you submit the request allow up to a day for your property to appear in VHR listings

target_groups.name: Bokun
target_groups.description_html:
Access and Guidelines

Note that submissions for Bokun section are rewarded with points only, they are not eligible for bounties.

Accounts

You must be using “vulnscan” prefix in your vendor/supplier name when registering for an account for both types of scans (manual and/or automatic). Do not create an excessive number of accounts. Two accounts should be enough for testing the marketplace whereas a single account should be enough for any other intent or purpose.

Types of scans

Please focus on manual testing rather than using automated tools as the latter are already employed. Nevertheless, if you choose to ignore this advice and use automated tools, you must ensure the request rate to our systems does not exceed a 1 request per second. On top of that, we would also kindly ask you to use a HTTP Agent header which identifies such requests.

Email us in advance (vulnerabilities@bokun.io) if you will be using an automated tool. Our working hours are mostly those in the UTC time zone.

It is strictly forbidden to run automated or manual vulnerability testing on production systems (listed in "Out of scope" section below).

Information on systems in scope

Alias to this environment is “test”. Both external domains are just synonyms to the same service. There should be no difference between using either of them.

Our test environment, hosted at extranet.bokuntest.com has virtually identical setup as prod component-wise. We use this environment to experiment with near-prod-ready code branches which are otherwise hard to simulate on local environments as well as for general test reasons. Note that this environment is also used by some of our customers which are businesses experimenting with API integrations and/or trying out our system in some other ways. Making changes to certain system elements might be visible for those customers (e.g. via Marketplace) and therefore we insist on following rules:

  • Do not create an infinite amount of certain entities, e.g. vendor accounts. If you managed to find a gap where such entities are allowed to be created without reasonable limit, you must stop early and let us know
  • Some of these entities are displayed for our customers in certain contexts. Refrain from profanity or other offensive language
  • If you want to test illegal data access between different multi-tenant accounts (IDOR etc) please create accounts on your own without harnessing existing accounts

Our system exposes the ability to have embeddable widgets. Widgets are publicly accessible resources and are made accessible via widget.bokuntest.com.
Similar to this, we provide a public RESTful API via api.bokuntest.com. We’re happy to work with you in providing more details for how to create relevant entities and access these both endpoints. Alternatively, consult our helpdesk page as creating widgets / using API should hopefully not be too complicated.

target_groups.name: Atlassian Forge
target_groups.description_html:
Atlassian Forge is an app development platform designed to revolutionize how Atlassian cloud products are customized, extended, and integrated.

More information on the platform can be found here: https://developer.atlassian.com/platform/forge/

Due to the collaborative nature of Atlassian products, we are not interested in vulnerabilities surrounding enumeration and information gathering (being able to work effectively as a team is the purpose of our products). Instead, we're more interested in vulnerabilities that can have a direct impact to the Forge Platform. Below is a list of some of the vulnerability classes that we are seeking reports for:

  • Forge Platform
  • Execution environment
  • Sandbox escapes
  • Supporting GraphQL endpoints
  • Access Control Vulnerabilities (Insecure Direct Object Reference issues, etc)
  • Server-Side Request Forgery (SSRF)
  • Forge CLI - https://www.npmjs.com/package/@forge/cli
  • Deployments
  • Forge App Installation/Uninstallation flows
  • UI Kit Stored/Reflected Cross-site Scripting (XSS) specifically targeting default behaviors of UI Kit elements

targets.name: Any customer instance. Do not test customer instances or affect customer data. Customer cloud instances may be in the form of <customer>.atlassian.net or <customer>.jira.com. Test only your own instances.
Any repository that you are not an owner of - do not impact Atlassian customers in any way.
First and third party apps and plugins from the marketplace are excluded from this bounty but may be in scope for https://bugcrowd.com/atlassianapps
HipChat (inc. HipChat Data Center, HipChat Desktop, HipChat Mobile)
Stride (inc. Stride Video, Stride Desktop, Stride Mobile)

name: OpenAI
tagline: OpenAI is an AI research and deployment company. Our mission is to ensure that artificial general intelligence benefits all of humanity.

target_groups.name: API Targets
target_groups.description_html:
The following services and applications are in-scope:

  • The OpenAI APIs.
  • Public cloud resources or infrastructure involved in serving the OpenAI API, including:
    • cloud storage accounts (e.g., Azure data blobs).
    • cloud compute servers (e.g., Azure virtual machines).

As noted earlier, model safety and content issues are not eligible for reward in any of the categories.

target_groups.name: ChatGPT
target_groups.description_html:
ChatGPT is in scope, including ChatGPT Plus, logins, subscriptions, OpenAI-created plugins (e.g. Browsing, Code Interpreter), plugins you create yourself, and all other functionality.

NOTE: You are not authorized to conduct security testing on plugins created by other people.

Examples of things we are interested in:

  • Stored or Reflected XSS
  • CSRF
  • SQLi
  • Authentication Issues
  • Authorization Issues
  • Data Exposure
  • Payments issues
  • Methods to bypass cloudflare protection by sending traffic to endpoints that are not protected by cloudflare
  • Ability to run queries on pre-release or private models
  • OpenAI created plugins:
    • Browsing
    • Code Interpreter
  • Security issues with the plugin creation system:
    • Outputs which cause the browser application to crash
    • Credential security
    • OAuth
    • SSRF
    • Methods to cause the plugin service to make calls to unrelated domains from where the manifest was loaded

Note: if your account is approved to create plugins, you may create and test your own plugins, their functionality, and their interactions with ChatGPT. You may sign up for the waitlist, but OpenAI and bugcrowd cannot get you off the waitlist, do not ask. You may not perform security testing on plugins created by other people (e.g. Plugins in the plugin store).

For model related issues, please use the reporting channels discussed earlier.
Model issues are strictly out of scope and will not be rewarded.

target_groups.name: Third Party Corporate Targets
target_groups.description_html:
This target group consists of confidential OpenAI corporate information that may be exposed through third parties. Some examples of the types vendors which would qualify in this category include:

  • Google Workspace
  • Asana, Trello, Jira, Monday.com
  • Notion, Confluence, Evernote
  • Intercom, Hubspot, Zendesk
  • Stripe, Airbase, Navan
  • Mode, Charthop, Looker

You are not authorized to perform additional security testing against these companies. Testing is limited to looking for confidential OpenAI information while following all laws and applicable terms of service. These companies are examples, and OpenAI does not necessarily do business with them.

Reports with multiple documents that share a root cause may be paid out at higher rates. Individual documents will typically be accepted at P4 or P5, which does not qualify for a monetary reward. For documents that contain particularly sensitive information, the reward category may be increased on a case-by-case basis. This will be rare.

Corporate target submissions must include detailed information to help us understand your discovery process.

target_groups.name: OpenAI API Keys
target_groups.description_html:
API Key Security Initiative for OpenAI

Our customers occasionally post their API keys on the internet. We need your help to keep them safe. Once a month, we will rank all submissions and award a bonus through the Bugcrowd platform to the researcher with the most impactful submission. Only the first submission of a given key will be considered. As a note, we will reach out to researchers that qualify for the reward. If you do not hear from us, it is safe to assume you did not win the current month. Please do not reach out to the Bugcrowd support team around the processing of these keys

  1. IMPORTANT: DO NOT SEND KEYS THROUGH BUGCROWD. Please report found API keys using the OpenAI API Key Bug Bounty Submission Form. Submissions to Bugcrowd will be marked as out-of-scope and will result in a point deduction.
  2. Do not post or share OpenAI API keys online.
  3. Valid OpenAI API Keys have the following structure: sk-w48. Any submission that does not adhere to this format will be rejected.
  4. Additional Things to Avoid:
    • Please don't submit the same keys repeatedly.
    • Don't create keys just to submit them.
    • Don't submit keys one-by-one - we can handle them in bulk.
  5. Creating multiple accounts or generating many API keys for a single account is a violation of our terms. This may result in account suspension. Play nicely. We keep a close eye on everything. Make sure that you act responsibly.

Thank you for your assistance!

This form is temporary - we will create an API for this soon.

Submit all findings here:
OpenAI API Key Bug Bounty Submission

IMPORTANT

Do not submit API keys to bugcrowd. The submission will be marked as out of scope and you will lose points. You must submit through the form.

target_groups.name: OpenAI Research Org
target_groups.description_html: Websites, services, and APIs operated by or for the OpenAI research organization. This category includes some websites which are subdomains of openai.com, but these targets will generally be found at openai.org and subdomains.

target_groups.name: Other OpenAI Targets
target_groups.description_html:
This target group includes:

  • The OpenAI.com website.
  • The OpenAI Developer Documentation.
  • The Developer playground.
  • Any other Internet-facing infrastructure operated by OpenAI and not specified in another target.
  • Any other public cloud resources or infrastructure operated by OpenAI.

name: Certinia (formerly FinancialForce)
tagline: Certinia gives you a complete, customer-centric view of your business on the world's #1 cloud platform from Salesforce

target_groups.name: In Scope Targets
target_groups.description_html:
At Certinia we leverage AWS for our cloud infrastructure, Cloudflare for DNS, along with a good number of SaaS tools.
Feel happy to report issues beyond what can be found under these domains (e.g., weaknesses based on OSINT) which may affect us. Essentially everything under the sun is in scope!

Note on fuzzing and automated tools

Generating large volumes of traffic (more than 5 requests per second) with fuzzers, directory brute force tools, port/vulnerability scanners, etc. is forbidden. Please configure your tools to avoid exceeding these limits.

target_groups.name: Out of Scope
target_groups.description_html: CVE-2021-26086 Limited Remote File Read/Include on Jira. We are aware of this issue and can confirm there is no security impact. The files exposed are all shipped with Jira out of the box.

targets.name: CVE-2021-26086 Limited Remote File Read/Include on Jir

target_groups.name: Trello Power Ups (Made by Trello)
target_groups.description_html:
Trello Power Ups allow you to bring additional features to Trello boards and integrate your favorite apps right into Trello. They can pull information and data from outside services directly into Trello. Only power ups made by Trello listed here are inscope for this program.
Note: Please report Calendar, Card aging, List Limits, Voting Power Ups to our Trello main program.

targets.name: First party (made-by-trello) power-ups other than those inscope are excluded from this program but can be reported to http://bugcrowd.com/atlassianapps

target_groups.name: Trello Third Party Powerups
target_groups.description_html:
Note on Trello Third Party Powerups

Trello Third Party Powerups are not officially under Atlassian ownership and do not follow the normal bug bounty security assessments. However, we may consider rewards for vulnerabilities found in Trello Third Party Powerups on a case by case basis if the vulnerability can affect Trello customers outside of the third party powerup (e.g. a valid XSS attack that can steal the Trello token of victim users).

The amount of the reward is based on the usage of the powerup and severity of the report and is much lower than the typical Trello reward. We typically reward only valid High and Critical (P2 and P1) severity reports.

Atlassian holds the right to eliminate rewards for third party powerups at any given time.
